unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra!**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra!**

unnormalised: Hey everyone, exciting news coming out of Maharashtra! Dr. Patil, a renewable energy researcher at IIT Bombay, announced a new initiative today to bring solar power to several villages in the Vidarbha region.
normalised: Hey everyone, exciting news coming out of Maharashtra! Doctor Patil, a renewable energy researcher at I I T Bombay, announced a new initiative today to bring solar power to several villages in the Vidarbha region.

unnormalised: This project aims to provide clean, affordable electricity to homes currently relying on unreliable power grids or, worse, expensive kerosene. The pilot project, covering approximately 50 sq ft per household rooftop, promises to significantly improve the quality of life for villagers like Aasha Tai and her family.
normalised: This project aims to provide clean, affordable electricity to homes currently relying on unreliable power grids or, worse, expensive kerosene. The pilot project, covering approximately fifty square feet per household rooftop, promises to significantly improve the quality of life for villagers like Aasha Tai and her family.

unnormalised: Funding for the Rs. 5 crore project comes from a partnership between the state government and a private renewable energy firm based in Pune. The initiative will not only light up homes but also power small businesses, boosting the local economy. Villages within a 20 km radius of the Nagpur solar plant will be prioritized. Initial estimates predict a reduction of carbon emissions by 10,000 tonnes annually. Let's hope this becomes a model for the rest of India!
normalised: Funding for the rupee five crore project comes from a partnership between the state government and a private renewable energy firm based in Pune. The initiative will not only light up homes but also power small businesses, boosting the local economy. Villages within a twenty kilometer radius of the Nagpur solar plant will be prioritized. Initial estimates predict a reduction of carbon emissions by ten thousand tonnes annually. Let's hope this becomes a model for the rest of India!
